column4: hi all! need help: i tried apt-get for k7-smp kernel but i cant get internet acess on http och ping any more. not with new or old kernel. writing this mess from stoopid-xp. any ideas?
Is your network card listed in 'ifconfig -a' ?
not easy to get your help when im in ubuntu at the time being :)
I would first check that the network card is present (ifconfig -a), that it is configured, that you can ping the gateway. One of these steps probably fails
first step works. i tried it. if second step fails where shoul i look for answer?
No idea. Could be a driver issue - havn't experienced any such problems with Ubuntu. It has quite a large database of drivers. Do you know what chipset your card is based on ?
SIS is known to be very Windows-only
nforce4 but internet was working before - htts how i got the new kernel :)
Why are you messing with the kernel ?
messing :) ? i found tips on how to speed ubu and kernel choice was one-- everyone else on the thread seemed to have 0 probs...
Ah, ok. Well, I would just leave the kernel as is if I were you :)
Don't think I can help you any further - except advice you not to tweak the kernel - it is perfectly fine as it is :)
